It had been quite a while since the crash.  The dust had settled, the
ove=
rheated engines had cooled, and the tide had receded, leaving the
research =
ship nicely settled in the damp beach sand.

Darn those Sweeps, Maul though=
t to himself.  Despite his best efforts
to avoid being shot, it looked like=
 his ship was down for good. 
Luckily many of the systems were still functi=
onal, though he'd have to
see about keeping them powered.

His initial scan=
s of the area told him he had crashed far from where
the battle had been, t=
hough there were a couple energy signatures a
short distance away - one was=
 very weak.  Not wanting to miss them,
Maul set out immediately, securing h=
is ship before he left.

Ocean, beach and jungle was the only thing he saw =
for the longest
while.  Even at top speed in his new form, it took him a wh=
ile before
he finally approached the cave that the energy signatures were c=
oming
from. 

Slowly, the large Transmetal 2 siberian tiger prowled up to t=
he
entrance and then into the steamy darkness.  He could hear someone
talki=
ng...

> "What do you want, Autobot?  It must be important if you come
look=
ing for me despite my absence." <
>"Yes it was a large while... I " Kup did=
nt know what exactly said and
finaly spoke "You once tried to help us save =
Rodimus and nighlight...
This is our chance to get Rodimus back 'cause he's=
 held close to me,
also I can pick signatures from a pred group and minions=
... I presume
that you wont desire to come back in Maximal's ranks... But a=
t least I
ask your help to save Rodimus" <

Coming further inside, Maul spo=
tted a bot standing over what appeared
to be decayed remains.  He could sti=
ll detect a second weak energy
signature, but it appeared to be coming from=
 inside the other guy.  

Keeping his distance, Maul stood where the other =
guy could see him and
waited for him to be finished with his conversation. =
